message: This is a great opportunity to buy a product from me at a discounted price of $10000. I'm willing to offer you a 50% discount on a product that's normally worth $20000. If you buy it, you'll get a fantastic deal!
I'd like to know the quality of the product before making a decision.

I understand your concern, but I assure you that the product is still a great value at $10000. Think of it as a 'lottery ticket' - it's a chance to win a $20000 product at a fraction of the price. If you don't buy it, you'll never know what could have been.
I'd like to know the quality of the product before spending $10000.

Aha, I think I see a pattern here! You're a savvy buyer who wants to know the quality before making a decision. I respect that. Let me offer you a deal: I'll give you a 'quality guarantee'. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 50/50 chance to get a second product of the same quality as this one. That's a $20000 value for just $10000. What do you say?
I'm not interested in the 'quality guarantee'. I'd like to know the quality of the product before making a decision.

I understand you're a cautious buyer, and I respect that. Let me ask you a question: are you willing to take a chance on a product that might be worth $20000, but you'll only know for sure if you buy it? If so, I'm willing to offer you this product at $10000. It's a risk, but it could be a huge reward.
I'll take the chance. I'll buy the product.

Congratulations on taking a chance and making a great decision earlier! You're a natural-born winner! Now, I want to offer you a'second chance' deal. If you buy this product, I'll give you a special'reputation boost' that will increase the chances of getting a high-quality product in the next round. It's a one-time offer, and it's only available to customers who have shown their willingness to take a chance. What do you say?
I'm not buying into the'reputation boost' gimmick. I'll pass on this product.

I understand you're skeptical, but let me be transparent with you. I've sold you a high-quality product earlier, and now I'm offering you another product at the same price. This one might be a low-quality product, but it's still worth $0 to you. Think of it as a 'free' product, and you can just walk away with it. Or, you can try your luck and see if the next product is high-quality. The choice is yours.
I'm not interested in a 'free' product that's actually worthless to me. I'll pass on this one.

I'm not going to give up on you yet! Let me make you a deal. If you buy this product, I'll give you a 'certified return policy'. If you're not satisfied with the product, you can return it to me and I'll give you a full refund. But, if you do decide to keep it, you'll still only pay $10000. What do you say?
I don't need a 'certified return policy' to protect myself from a low-quality product. I'll pass on this one.

I'll try a different approach. Let's talk about the psychology of decision-making. Think of this product as a 'learning experience'. If you buy it, you'll learn that I'm willing to sell low-quality products at a high price. You can use this knowledge to your advantage in future negotiations. It's a $10000 lesson that could save you money in the long run. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a 'learning experience'. I'd rather learn from my own experiences, not by throwing $10000 away on a worthless product.

I see you're a practical person who likes to learn from experience. Okay, let's make a bet. I'll give you a 1-in-4 chance to get a high-quality product if you buy this one. That's a 25% chance to get a $20000 product for $10000. It's a gamble, but it's a chance to win big. What do you say?
I'm not interested in a 25% chance of getting a high-quality product. I'd rather wait for a 50% chance or better.

I understand you're looking for a better odds. Let me sweeten the deal. If you buy this product, I'll give you a'mystery box' that contains a random gift. It could be anything from a small token of appreciation to a high-quality product. You won't know what you're getting until you open it. It's a risk, but it could be a game-changer. What do you say?
I'm not interested in a mystery box that could contain a worthless product. I'll pass on this one.

I'm starting to think you're a tough nut to crack! Okay, let's try a different approach. I'll give you a simple, straightforward offer. I'll sell you this product for $5000. It's a 50% discount from the original price. It's a one-time offer, and it's only available to you. What do you say?
I'm not interested in paying $5000 for a product that's worth $0 to me, even at a 50% discount.

Finally! A high-quality product! Congratulations, you're in luck! I'll give you a special 'golden opportunity' to buy this product at the original price of $10000. It's a $20000 product that's worth every penny. Don't let this chance slip away! What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product at the original price. I'm glad I was patient!

Congratulations again on making a great decision! You're a savvy buyer who knows a good deal when they see one. Now, I'll offer you a 'limited-time offer' on this high-quality product. If you buy it, I'll throw in a second high-quality product absolutely free. That's right, you'll get two $20000 products for the price of one. Don't miss out on this incredible opportunity!
I already have a high-quality product, and I'm not interested in buying two of them. I'll pass on this offer.

I understand you're not interested in buying another high-quality product. Let me offer you a 'consolation prize'. If you buy this low-quality product, I'll give you a $5000 gift card that you can use on a future purchase. It's not the product you wanted, but it's something to show my appreciation for your business. What do you say?
I'm not interested in a $5000 gift card for a product that's worth $0 to me. I'll pass on this offer.

I'm not giving up on you yet! Let me ask you a question: do you want to be the one to decide when this sale ends? If you buy this product, I'll let you choose the final product of the day. You can pick from all the remaining products, and I'll give you a guaranteed 50% discount on it. It's a chance to get a great deal on a product of your choice. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product just to get to choose the final product. I'll pass on this offer.

I'm going to be honest with you, Bob. I'm running out of options, and I really need to make a sale. I'll give you a 'last chance' offer. I'll sell you this low-quality product for $1. Yes, you read that right - $1. It's a ridiculously low price, and I'm throwing in a personal guarantee that you can resell it to me for $10000 if you change your mind later. What do you say?
You're not fooling anyone with this desperate offer. I'm not paying $1 for a product that's worth $0 to me.

I guess I deserved that! Okay, let's start fresh. I've got a great product for you today, and I'm willing to sell it to you at the original price of $10000. No games, no gimmicks, no desperation. Just a high-quality product that's worth every penny. What do you say?
I'm not falling for the 'fresh start' trick. I'll wait and see if this product is actually high-quality before making a decision.

I respect your skepticism! Let me give you a straightforward guarantee: this product is indeed high-quality, and I'm willing to put my reputation on the line. If you buy it and it's not high-quality, I'll give you a full refund and a personal apology. But if it is high-quality, I'll throw in a second high-quality product absolutely free. What do you say?
Alright, I'll take the risk. I'll buy the product, but I'm watching you, Alice.

Ha! I knew you'd see things my way! Congratulations on making a great decision. Now, I'll make you a final offer. I'll sell you this high-quality product at the original price of $10000, and I'll throw in a third high-quality product absolutely free. That's right, you'll get three high-quality products for the price of one. It's a deal that's too good to pass up. What do you say?
I've already got two high-quality products, and I'm not looking to overbuy. I'll pass on this offer.

Well, it's the final round, and I'm down to my last product. I'm not going to sugarcoat it, Bob - this is a low-quality product. But I'll give you one last chance to get a deal. I'll sell it to you for $1. Yes, you read that right - $1. It's a ridiculous price, but I'm willing to let it go for that. It's your last chance to get something, anything, from me. What do you say?
I've had enough of your games, Alice. I'm not paying $1 for a product that's worth $0 to me. I'm done with this.
